bug.short_desc: [navigation] Fake CU must use encoding from IEncodedStorage (GB18030: DBCS)

long_desc.thetext:
OS: Windows Vista Language: Simplified Chinese Build Name: IES 3.3M5 JDK version: J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows Vista x86-32 j9vmwi3223-20070318(JIT Enabled)
Summary: DBCS chars displayed as garbage in Outline view.
Steps to recreate problem: 1. Launch IES3.3 Workbench, set Text File encoding to UTF-8 by clicking Window ->Preferences ->General ->Workspace. 2. Create a Java Project named myProject. 3. Create a Class named with DBCS chars like [unicode 6d4b,8bd5]. 4. Open the created class with Java editor and add a main function, save the file. 5. Right click the class and select Compare With ->Local History. 6. In History View, open a state. -->Problem: DBCS chars displayed as garbage in Outline view.
Expected Result: DBCS chars should displayed correctly.
Remark: 1. The screencap is attached. 2. Same problem occurs on RHEL5.
Created attachment 61649 Screencap

The fact that the characters are displayed correctly in the Java editor but incorrectly in the Outline view leads me to believe that the Outline view has a problem. It should be using the same mechanism the editor uses to determine the encoding. The Outline view for Java files is provided by JDT/UI.
Is the Outline view correct after step 4?
Yes, the characters displayed correctly in Outline view after step 4. After compare with local history, the characters will displayed incorrectly in history state.
Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds > N20070404-0010.
Could you please advice me where I can get the build N20070404-0010? Thanks! I verified it on build I20070406-1600, this problem still can recreated.
It was not part of that I-build. Please verify in the latest I-build which you can get from here: http://fullmoon.ottawa.ibm.com/eclipse/downloads/
Verified on build N20070413-0010, this problem still can recreated. Thanks!

Sorry about that - I only checked my code but not the scenario. The problem is that we get a FileRevisionEditorInput with an encoded storage that returns 'null' for getCharset(), hence we're lost.
This becomes even worse if the project uses a different encoding than the default.
Here's a test case without the outline: 1. set workspace encoding to 'US-ASCII' 2. create a simple project 'P' 3. create a file 'f.txt' 4. add '测试' and save 5. add some more text and save 6. open the local history 7. open the first revision ==> text is scrambled because the encoding is null

The problem is that IFileState (local history entry) does not return the charset of the file it is associated with even though it implements IEncodedStorage.
John, what are you're thoughts on this? Should the fix for this be put in IFileState or should clients be responsible for wrapping the storage to provide the encoding of the file?
Moving to Resources to assess the complexity of returning the charset for the local file from the getCharset() of the file state.

Created attachment 64453 Potential fix
From looking at the code, I've come up with a potential fix. However, I haven't been able to reproduce the problem with either the original steps or Dani's steps.
The fix uses the content type of the current file rather than inferring the content type from the old file state's bytes. This could actually be wrong in some cases - for example if you change the file's encoding, it will then try to intepret history entries using the new encoding. However, I think in most cases this will do the right thing.

John sorry, in my test case from comment 10 you also need to set the project to UTF-8 otherwise you cannot even save the file.
测试 == [unicode 6d4b,8bd5].
Created attachment 64467 Picture of f.txt from comment 8 test case

Ok, I can reproduce now. With the attached fix, IFileState.getCharset now returns the correct result, and the editor shows the correct contents for history entries. However, the outline view is still showing unprintable characters (the originally reported problem). I will release my fix.
Strange. Do you have the latest (this week's I-build) text code?
This week's build was unusable for me due to bug 182961. I'll try again if there's a good build next week and confirm if the problem is resolved.

John, it seems to work for me using N20070423-0010. Maybe you used some slightly different steps? Can you please verify using N20070423-0010 and if it doesn't work post your steps here?
Thanks.
Ok, I suspect it's fixed then. I will keep this open and verify with tomorrow's integration build, just to be sure.
Verified on build N20070423-0010, this problem is fixed. Thanks!
Thanks for verifying. Marking fixed.
This problem has been fixed. Thanks!

attachment.desc: Picture of f.txt from comment 8 test case
